data.title: VS Code quits on launch

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In Finder, go to Applications folder and double click Visual Studio Code.
2. The app icon will show in the dock for a few seconds as if it's launching and then it will disappear and the app quits.

It seems kind of similar to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7927 in that my Console shows this error message:

> 2/1/17 11:17:03.998 AM com.apple.xpc.launchd[1]: (com.microsoft.VSCode.400352[31293]) Service exited with abnormal code: 1

It's different from that issue because I can't even launch VS Code from terminal.
VSCode was working before but I was having issues with the auto updater so I tried reinstalling it and then this issue started happening. If it matters, I installed the app through our company setup of [Managed Software Center](https://github.com/munki/munki).

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: win7 64 bit

Steps to Reproduce:

I am using Visual Studio Code, and it has a insert comment feature (CTRL-/) or SHFT-ALT-A

but it is inserting javascript style comments into my HTML file

original
```
<script src="./node_modules/react/dist/react.js"></script>
<script src="./node_modules/react-dom/dist/react-dom.js"></script>
```

result:
```
// <script src="./node_modules/react/dist/react.js"></script>
// <script src="./node_modules/react-dom/dist/react-dom.js"></script>

```
Which does not work, I searched prior issues, but I might have missed this.

data.title: Reload extension button never goes away
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Linux Mint (same issue on windows 8)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. On a fresh, new installation of VSCode, install the hello plugin : `ext install hello`
2. Click the reload button, the extension is loaded correctly, everything is fine
3. Goto ~/.vscode/extensions/hypnoes.hello-0.1.1 
4. Open package.json 
5. Change lines
```json
	"name": "hello",
	"displayName": "Hello",
```
to

```json
	"name": "Hello",
```

uppercase Hello.

6. Launch VSCode and go to extensions tab
7. The reload button is shown in Hello extension (and will never goes away) but the extension is loaded and works perfectly well

data.title: View SCM command shown twice in Command Palette
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.9.0 insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Command Palette and SCM: Enable Preview SCM. Reload VS Code.
2. Reopen Command Palette and type "SCM"
3. Two View: View SCM commands are shown, one without a keybinding and one with.

![twoscm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12818376/22520921/051d28b0-e86b-11e6-9de7-a7f46689d553.png)

The View menu View SCM does not show the keyboard shortcut.

data.title: Cannot connect to SQL Server
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:42:49.304Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.2.0|

---

I am unable to connect to a SQL Server instance using VSCode and mssql 0.2.0.

I am able to successfully connect to this server using other SQL Dev tools like Razor and Excel. When I try and connect with VSCode, it will eventually timeout.


[11:50:34 AM] Connecting to server "###.###.###.###" on document "untitled:Untitled-1".

[11:54:37 AM] Error connecting to server "###.###.###.###". Details: Connection Timeout Expired.  The timeout period elapsed during the post-login phase.  The connection could have timed out while waiting for server to complete the login process and respond; Or it could have timed out while attempting to create multiple active connections.  The duration spent while attempting to connect to this server was - [Pre-Login] initialization=135; handshake=276; [Login] initialization=0; authentication=0; [Post-Login] complete=14004; 


I have tried the following:
Using an IP Address or hostname (which resolves correctly).
Using different connection parameters (Timeout, Authentication Types etc).


I have no idea what the issue could be. The server is technically remote but is being accessed through a VPN and like I said, I have no issues connecting using Razor or Excel for Mac 2016.

Any thoughts on what this could be?

|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit a file in source depot (ie. sd edit <file>).
2. Open the file in vs code (ie. code <file>).
3. Make changes to file.
4. Try to save. I know that the file is not read only b/c notepad and visual studio have no qualms about saving the file.

data.title: [Debug] Cannot launch node2 debug configuration for electron application
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

I have an electron application. When using `"type": "node"` in `launch.config` debugging is going fine. When I change to `"type": "node2"`, I get the following error message at the start:

> Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:5372).

Restarting VS Code doesn't help.

I've noticed that when using `"type": "node"`, I get the following output in Debug Console:
`c:\dev\myApp/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd --debug-brk=11978 c:\dev\myApp --enable-logging --remote-debugging-port=9222 built\app.js `

And for `"type": "node2"`:
`c:\dev\myApp/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd --inspect=5372 --debug-brk c:\dev\myApp --enable-logging --remote-debugging-port=9222 built\app.js `

In `"node"` case VS Code uses `--debug-brk=11978` parameter and in `"node2"` case it uses `--inspect=5372`.

data.title: Hit and miss showing selected object on right bar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.2|
|numbered-bookmarks|alefragnani|0.6.0|
|code-gnu-global|austin|0.2.1|
|one-monokai|azemoh|0.2.4|
|vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark|be5invis|1.2.5|
|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.10.0|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.7|
|findfile|HastenS|0.0.4|
|rubyblue-theme|hirofumii|1.0.2|
|format-indent|Kasik96|1.3.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.0|
|autotrim|NathanRidley|1.0.6|
|theme-earlytorise|PasqNet|0.0.9|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.15.1|
|polscript|vitorfdl|2.1.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

.js files only.

When you double click JQuery code to highlight it, some things like variables will show as white squares of reference points throughout your page.  That's what is working.

This isn't consistent for other things that aren't variables.

 $('#item1_' + variable).prop('disabled', true);
 $('#item2_' + variable).prop('disabled', true);
 $('#item3_' + variable).prop('disabled', true);
 $('#item1_' + variable).prop('disabled', true);

1.Double click variable and it highlights the scroll-bar with the white reference place markers.
2.Double click item1_, nothing shows on the scroll bar.
3.Double click .prop nothing shows on the scroll bar.
4.Double click disable nothing shows on the scroll bar.
5. Double click true nothing shows on the scroll bar.

data.title: slow down when lots of output is written to debug console.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.8.0|
|sublime-keybindings|ms-vscode|1.6.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Write a application that logs thousands of lines in a single run.   Say 25,000 to 35,000 outputted log messages.
2.  run that application several times in a row.  
3.  watch vscode slow down, to the point you can't click on anything.      

Workarounds:   

1. Periodically clear the console manually.
2.  close vscode window and start another one. 

Possible solution:   

1. Limit the # of scroll back lines in the console.   So that you use a finite amount of ram.   
2. automatically clear the console at the start of the next debug execution.

data.title: [Debug] Wrong launch configuration is selected when trying to launch a compound configuration when launch.json become opened in editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Wrong launch configuration is selected for debugging when trying to launch a compound configuration if `launch.json` become opened in the editor. VS Code often opens `launch.json` automatically after starting a compound configuration (have never seen the same for a regular, not compound configuration). But in some cases it doesn't open, and when it doesn't the correct configuration is selected. But when `launch.json` becomes open, the wrong configuration is selected and an info message bubbles up:
> Please set up the launch configuration file for your application.

Right before the start of `multi` configuration:

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4777512/22514304/f37f0c50-e8af-11e6-88ea-aba27237bc86.png)

Right after the start of `multi` configuration:

![untitled2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4777512/22514029/0f3d95ca-e8af-11e6-8acb-4af8b7affd89.png)

Moving to different sections of navbar, reopening the `launch.json` file, restarting VS Code - doesn't help.

Contents of `.vscode\launch.json` file:
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "main",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/src/app.ts",
            "outFiles": [
                "${workspaceRoot}/built/**/*.js"
            ],
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "smartStep": true,
            "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd",
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "${workspaceRoot}",
                "--enable-logging",
                "--remote-debugging-port=9222"
            ],
            "preLaunchTask": "build"
        },
        {
            "type": "chrome",
            "request": "attach",
            "name": "renderer",
            "port": 9222,
            "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}/built",
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "smartStep": true
        }
    ],
    "compounds": [
        {
            "name": "multi",
            "configurations": [
                "main",
                "renderer"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
```

Contents of `.vscode\tasks.json` file:
```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "npm",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "showOutput": "always",
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "build",
            "args": ["run", "build"]
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: [Debug] Execution stops in a TypeScript source file at a code line without a breakpoint and debugger statement
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Execution stops in a TypeScript source file at a code line without a breakpoint and debugger statement. Actually there was once a breakpoint before, but I removed it. Nevertheless the execution continues to stop at that line. Tried to reset breakpoint there, rebuild the code, restart VS Code - doesn't help.

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4777512/22513304/e33dad22-e8ac-11e6-9259-c9f868cf4c80.png)

Don't know how to reproduce this with an arbitrary code line, but it stable reproduces with this line.

If you need some additional info - let me know.

Contents of `.vscode\launch.json`:
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "main",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/src/app.ts",
            "outFiles": [
                "${workspaceRoot}/built/**/*.js"
            ],
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "smartStep": true,
            "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd",
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "${workspaceRoot}",
                "--enable-logging",
                "--remote-debugging-port=9222"
            ],
            "preLaunchTask": "build"
        },
        {
            "type": "chrome",
            "request": "attach",
            "name": "renderer",
            "port": 9222,
            "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}/built",
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "smartStep": true
        }
    ],
    "compounds": [
        {
            "name": "multi",
            "configurations": [
                "main",
                "renderer"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Image in extension folder does not display with previewHtml a TextDocumentContentProvider
[Debug] Make configurable attach timeout for chrome debugging
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Would like to have an option to change attach timeout because there are times when the app being debugged need more time to initialize before getting ready to accept attach request than hardcoded 10 seconds. Especially when using hybrid debugging and/or prelaunch task take up time.

Right now there is only a hacky way to change it - by opening the file
`c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\ms-vscode.node-debug\out\node\nodeDebug.js`

and changing `NodeDebugSession.ATTACH_TIMEOUT` constant's value to the desired.

data.title: Fix explorer selection state when drag ends
data.body:
Fixes #2367

When a file is dragged onto tree view from desktop and escape key is pressed, the `dragend` event does not fire.

This fix relies on the property that such an event has a position of (0 , 0).

data.title: Do not expect app.getPath('userData') to be there before app.once('ready')
data.body:
There is a discussion going on in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/08a1700e7fbd5104516688821d7ff83eb8a52bc7 where @chrmarti saw an issue on startup for new users that never started Code before. I never saw this issue but the fix seems odd to me: we now suddenly create the directory (`userData`) via `mkdirp` that is owned by Electron/Chrome, which seems wrong. It should be created by the framework, not us.

Can we move the `getNodeCachedDataDir()` into the `app.once('ready')` callback? That is the place where all code should go that assumes a certain directory structure to be present, not before.

I opened via explorer a _empty_ text file. This PC should rock on perf and I did this as it was noticeably slower...

data.title: Deselect multiple cursors
data.body:
When you use multiple cursors using <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>Click</kbd>, you can add multiple cursors, but you can't deselect a cursor. Once you clicked, you can't unclick it, other than <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>u</kbd>, which undoes the last cursor action.

Can you add a deselect feature, where you <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>Click</kbd> on an added cursor to deselect it?
